intro: Salsola ruthenica var. pontica, commonly known as Pontic sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the steppes and semi-desert regions of Eastern Europe and Western Asia. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of greenish-yellow flowers in the summer. It is adapted to arid and saline environments, making it a hardy species often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of dryland ecosystems and a subject of study in ecological and agricultural research.
